com.twilio.client

Interface Connection

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Parcelable

    public interface Connection
extends Parcelable
    A Connection object represents the connection between a Device and Twilio's services. A Connection is either incoming or outgoing. You do not create a Connection directly; an outgoing connection is created by calling the Device.connect(Map, ConnectionListener) method. Incoming connections are created internally by a Device and handed to the registered incoming PendingIntent registered via Device.setIncomingIntent(PendingIntent).

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes

    • Field Detail

      • IncomingParameterFromKey

        static final String IncomingParameterFromKey
        String representing the calling party. If the caller is a telephone, it will be in the E.164 format. If the caller is another Twilio Client, it will be in a URI format "client:name".
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • IncomingParameterToKey

        static final String IncomingParameterToKey
        String representing the client name of the called party. This is in a URI format "client:name".
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • IncomingParameterAccountSIDKey

        static final String IncomingParameterAccountSIDKey
        String representing the account id making the incoming call.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • IncomingParameterAPIVersionKey

        static final String IncomingParameterAPIVersionKey
        String representing the version of the Twilio API used in the server application.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • IncomingParameterCallSIDKey

        static final String IncomingParameterCallSIDKey
        String representing a unique identifier for the incoming call.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Method Detail

      • getState

        Connection.State getState()
        Retrieves the current state of the connection.
        Returns:
        The connection state, as a Connection.State enum value
        See Also:
        Connection.State

      • getParameters

        Map<String,String> getParameters()
        Retrieves the set of application parameters associated with this connection. Incoming connection parameters are defined by set of values described by the constants in this interface that start with IncomingParameter. Outgoing connection parameters are defined by the union of optional application parameters specified in the Capability Token and any additional parameters specified when the Device.connect(Map, ConnectionListener) method is called.
        Returns:
        an unmodifiable Map of key/value pairs for the Connection, or null if no parameters were set.

      • isIncoming

        boolean isIncoming()
        A boolean representing if the Connection is an incoming or outgoing connection.
        Returns:
        true if the connection is an incoming connection, false if outgoing

      • accept

        void accept()
        Accepts an incoming connection request. When an incoming connection is received, and your PendingIntent is activated, calling this method will accept the incoming connection. Calling this method on a Connection that is not in the Connection.State.PENDING state will have no effect.
        See Also:
        isIncoming()

      • ignore

        void ignore()
        Ignores an incoming connection request. The caller will receive no notification that the call was ignored. When an incoming connection is received, and your PendingIntent is activated, calling ignore will close the incoming connection request and the connection may not be accepted. Calling this method on a Connection that is not in the Connection.State.PENDING state will have no effect. The ConnectionListener will eventually receive a ConnectionListener.onDisconnected(Connection) callback once the connection is terminated.
        See Also:
        isIncoming()

      • reject

        void reject()
        Rejects an incoming connection request. The caller may receive a notification that the call was rejected. When an incoming connection is received, and your PendingIntent is activated, calling reject will terminate the request, notifying the caller that the call was rejected. Calling this method on a Connection that is not in the Connection.State.PENDING state will have no effect. The ConnectionListener will eventually receive a ConnectionListener.onDisconnected(Connection) callback once the connection is terminated.
        See Also:
        isIncoming()

      • disconnect

        void disconnect()
        Disconnect the connection. Calling this method on a Connection that is in the Connection.State.DISCONNECTED state will have no effect. The ConnectionListener will eventually receive a ConnectionListener.onDisconnected(Connection) callback once the connection is terminated.

      • setMuted

        void setMuted(boolean muted)
        Mutes or unmutes the microphone's audio for the connection.
        Parameters:
        muted - true to mute, false to unmute
        See Also:
        isMuted()

      • isMuted

        boolean isMuted()
        Reports whether the microphone's audio for the connection is muted.
        Returns:
        true if the audio is muted, false otherwise.
        See Also:
        setMuted(boolean)

      • sendDigits

        void sendDigits(String inDigitsString)
        Send a string of digits over the connection. Valid digits are '0' - '9', '*', '#', and 'w'. Each 'w' will cause a 500 ms pause between digits sent. If any invalid character is present, no digits will be sent. Calling this method on a Connection that not is in the Connection.State.CONNECTED state will have no effect.
        Parameters:
        inDigitsString - a String of one or more valid digits and optional 'w' chars.

      • setConnectionListener

        void setConnectionListener(ConnectionListener inListener)
        Sets the ConnectionListener to receive connection state events.
        Parameters:
        inListener - The ConnectionListener object
        See Also:
        ConnectionListener
